page.title: 07HUNTON VILLAGE
page.content: OUR AREA WAS IN HUNTON VILLAGE. WE STARTED AT THE SCHOOL, WHICH WAS BUILT IN 1963, MAKING IT JUST 22 YEARS OLD.THIS MAKES IT VERY MODERN INDEED. THERE WERE 42 CHILDREN WHEN THE SCHOOL WAS FIRST BUILT, AND WHEN THE PRESENT HEADMASTER,MR.KEMP CAME THERE WERE 64 CHILDREN BUT NOW THERE ARE ONLY 36. THERE ARE ALMS HOUSES NEXT TO THE SCHOLL WHICH ARE OWNED BY THE CHURCH. THERE ARE NO SHOPS, JUST A POST OFFICE. THE MOST RECENT SHOP TO BE CLOSED IS THE GROCER'S. ACROSS THE ROAD FROM THE SCHOOL IS A ROW OF HOUSES - QUITE NEW, ABOUT 5-6 YEARS OLD. THERE IS A VILLAGE HALL BY THE TELEPHONE BOX AND THE LOCAL PEOPLE CALL IT A "WORKING-MENS"CLUB. ORIGINALLY THE HOUSES IN BENSTEAD CLOSE WERE COUNCIL OWNED - NOW THEY ARE PRIVATELY OWNED.
